documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: expat security update

note.text:
An update for expat is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.7 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
Expat is a C library for parsing XML documents.

Security Fix(es):

* expat: Integer overflow leading to buffer overflow in XML_GetBuffer() (CVE-2015-2716)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
note.title: Details

note.text: expat: Integer overflow leading to buffer overflow in XML_GetBuffer()
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the updated packages, applications using the Expat library must be restarted for the update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#1220607: CVE-2015-2716 expat: Integer overflow leading to buffer overflow in XML_GetBuffer()
